tn.ref: that he collapsed on the face of his father
tn.text: The term "he collapsed" is an idiom for being overcome. AT: "that he fell on his father in grief" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
"his servants who took care of dead bodies"
To "embalm" is a special way of preserving a dead body before it is buried. AT: "to prepare his father's body for burial" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]])
"They took 40 days" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
"70 days" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
"days of mourning him" or "days of weeping for him"

tn.ref: Joseph spoke to Pharaoh's royal court
tn.text: Here "royal court" stands for the officials that make up Pharaoh's royal court. AT: "Joseph spoke to Pharaoh's officials" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: If now I have found favor in your eyes
tn.text: The phrase "in your eyes" is a metonym that stands for Jacob's thoughts or opinion.  AT: "If I have found favor with you" or "If you are pleased with me" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
This is an idiom that means that someone is approved of by someone else. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: please speak to Pharaoh, saying, 'My father made me swear, saying, "See, I am about to die. Bury me in my tomb that I dug for myself in the land of Canaan. There you will bury me." Now let me go up and bury my father, and then I will return.'
tn.text: This has a two level quotation and three level quotation. These can be stated as indirect quotations. AT: "please tell Pharaoh that my father made me swear that after he dies I would bury him in the tomb that he dug for himself in the land of Canaan. Please ask Pharaoh to let me go bury my father, and then I will return" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_quotesinquotes]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_quotations]])

tn.ref: See, I am about to die
tn.text: "See, I am dying"
It was common to use the phrase "go up" when speaking of traveling from Egypt to Canaan.
It is implied that the members of the court spoke to Pharaoh, and now Pharaoh is replying to Joseph. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
"as you swore to him"
It was common to use the phrase "went up" when speaking of traveling from Egypt to Canaan.

tn.ref: All the officials ... the courtiers ... the senior officials
tn.text: All of Pharaoh's most important leaders attended the burial procession.
This person was a royal advisor.
Here "household" refers to Pharaoh's royal court.

tn.ref: land of Egypt, with all Joseph's household and his brothers, and his father's household
tn.text: This can be translated as a new sentence: "land of Egypt. Joseph's household, his brothers, and his father's household also went with him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_events]])
Here "household" refers to their families.
Here this stands for the men riding in the chariots. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: It was a very large group of people
tn.text: "It was a very large gathering"
The word "they" refers to the participants in the burial procession.

Possible meanings are 1) the word "Atad" means "thorn" and it may refer to a place where large amounts of thorns grew, or 2) it may be the name of the person who owns the threshing floor. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: they mourned with very great and grievous sorrow
tn.text: "they were extremely sad and they mourned very much"
"a 7 day" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
"in the threshing floor of Atad" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: This is a very sad occasion for the Egyptians
tn.text: "The mourning of the Egyptians is very great"
The translator can add a footnote that says: "The name Abel Mizraim means "the mourning of Egypt.'" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
"So Jacob's sons"

tn.ref: just as he had instructed them
tn.text: "just as he had directed them"
"His sons took his body"
Machpela was the name of an area or region. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:gen:23:07|23:9]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

This was another name for the city of Hebron. It may have been named after Mamre, the friend of Abraham who lived there. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:gen:13:16|13:18]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This is the name of a man. "Hittite" means "descendent of Heth." See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:gen:23:07|23:8]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
"Joseph returned to Egypt"
"all who had come with him"

tn.ref: What if Joseph holds on to anger against us
tn.text: Here anger is spoken of as if it was something physical that Joseph could hold in his hands. AT: "What if Joseph is actually still angry with us" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: wants to repay us in full for all the evil we did to him
tn.text: Avenging oneself against someone who harmed him is spoken of as if the person were paying they other person what they are owed. AT: "wants revenge for the evil thing we did to him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: Your father gave instructions before he died, saying, 'Tell Joseph this, "Please forgive the transgression of your brothers and their sin when they did evil to you."'
tn.text: This has a two level quotation and a three level quotation. They can be stated as indirect quotations. AT: "Your father instructed us before he died to tell you to forgive us for the evil thing we did to you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_quotesinquotes]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_quotations]])

tn.ref: Your father gave instructions before he died, saying
tn.text: Jacob was the father of all the brothers. Here they say "your father" to emphasize that Joseph needs to pay attention to what his father said. AT: "Before our father died he said"

tn.ref: and their sin when they did evil to you
tn.text: "for the wicked things they did to you"
This does not mean "at this moment," but is used to draw attention to the important point that follows.

tn.ref: please forgive the servants of the God of your father
tn.text: The brothers are referring to themselves as "the servants of the God of your father." This can be stated in first person. AT: "please forgive us, the servants of the God of our father" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_123person]])

tn.ref: Joseph wept when they spoke to him
tn.text: "Joseph wept when he heard this message"
They lay down with their faces toward the ground. This is a sign of humility and respect for Joseph. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_symaction]])

tn.ref: Am I in the place of God?
tn.text: Joseph uses a question to comfort his brothers. AT: "I am not in the place of God" or "I am not God." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
"you intended to do evil against me"
"God intended it for good"

tn.ref: So now do not be afraid
tn.text: "So do not fear me"

tn.ref: I will provide for you and your little children
tn.text: "I will always make sure you and your children have enough to eat"

tn.ref: He comforted them in this way and spoke kindly to them
tn.text: "He comforted them by speaking kindly to them"
"110 years" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

tn.ref: Ephraim's children to the third generation
tn.text: "Ephraim's children and grandchildren" (UDB)
This is the name of Joseph's grandson. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: who were placed on the knees of Joseph
tn.text: This expression means that Joseph adopted these children of Machir as his own children. This means they would have special inheritance rights from Joseph. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
In [[:en:bible:notes:gen:50:24|50:24/26]] the word "you" refers to Joseph's brothers, but it also stands for their descendants. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: lead you up out of this land to the land
tn.text: It was common to use the word "up" when speaking of traveling from Egypt to Canaan. AT: "bring you out of this land and take you to the land" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_events]])
To "embalm" is a special way of preserving a dead body before it is buried. See how you translated "embalmed" in [[:en:bible:notes:gen:50:01|50:1]].
This can be stated in active form. AT: "they placed him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"in a chest" or "in a case." This is a box a dead person is placed in.
